result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon C. Anderson Jr.

records.addlTxt: Body Only. Adjoining States. Signed by RMW on 5/26/2022. c: SCSO. km

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius   DF:  Leon C. Anderson did not appear. Case called at 9:08 a.m. Court notes this matter is scheduled for arraignment. DE was extradited to Illinois. Atty Satorius believes there may be a hold. State requesting warrant. Court based on non appearance will issue warrant.
for family to appear via zoom. Filed by A. Thompson (Relative of DE). arc    PER SRN,  Not victims and do not generally conduct zoom court. arc

03:39 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Leon C. Anderson appeared from jail.  Court reviews file, set for Pleas.  Atty Satorius would like a little more time before continuing.  Court will set this out for PTC with Branch IV.  Atty Satorius makes statements. DE makes statements.  Court responds.  Bond remains in form and amount.  Adjourned 3:46 PM. bph  Arraignment scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

04:11 PM  CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Leon C. Anderson appeared from jail. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty. Satorius requests plea/sentencing early next week, notes DE waived extradition to Illinois. Court sets PLEAS with Branch 3, DE agrees to Branch 3 hearing case for purposes of plea/sentencing. Adjourned: 4:19 PM. kma  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Filed by Atty Satorius. arc   e: DA

- No possession of any dangerous weapons

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito with Travis Satorius   DF:  Leon C. Anderson appeared from jail via video. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Atty Dippolito met with DE and he qualifies for PD services. ADA Ellenwood states DE has an extraditable warrant out of Illinois.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
